sections.title: Overview
sections.content: Laos, officially the Lao People’s Democratic Republic, is a landlocked country in Southeast Asia. It is known for its mountainous terrain, rivers, Buddhist culture, and relaxed way of life.

sections.title: Capital City
sections.content: Vientiane is the capital and largest city of Laos. It serves as the country’s political, economic, and cultural center.

sections.title: Currency
sections.content: The official currency of Laos is the Lao kip (LAK).

sections.title: Language
sections.content: The official language is Lao. English is increasingly spoken in tourism areas, along with some French influence from colonial times.

sections.title: Traditional Food
sections.content: Lao cuisine is known for its fresh herbs and bold flavors, with popular dishes such as larb, sticky rice (khao niao), and tam mak hoong (papaya salad).

sections.title: Geography
sections.content: Laos is mostly mountainous and forested, with the Mekong River running along much of its western border. It has a tropical monsoon climate.

sections.title: Culture
sections.content: Lao culture is deeply influenced by Theravada Buddhism, with strong values placed on respect, community, and traditional festivals such as Boun Pi Mai (Lao New Year).

sections.title: Tourism
sections.content: Popular tourist attractions include Luang Prabang, Kuang Si Falls, Vang Vieng, and the Plain of Jars.

sections.title: Fun Fact
sections.content: Laos is the only landlocked country in Southeast Asia.

history.event: The Kingdom of Lan Xang was founded, becoming one of the most powerful kingdoms in Southeast Asia.
Lan Xang split into smaller kingdoms, weakening the region.
Laos became part of French Indochina under colonial rule.
The Lao People’s Democratic Republic was established.
